course_title: One Health: Animals, the Environment & Human Disease

learning_outcomes.description: Develop and describe key concepts in One Health, including how medical, veterinary, ecological disciplinary fields intersect.
Using topical examples outline the causes of health issues at the human-animal interface, their impacts and approaches to control and prevention.
Work independently to access, assimilate and critically evaluate information pertaining to One Health scenarios.
Use effective teamwork to investigate, problem-solve and evaluate One Health scenarios.
Apply One Health concepts and skills to different contexts (e.g. societal, geographic), recognising the global importance and approaches to control for One Health problems.

assessments.assessment_title: Tutor assessment of case study achievement
assessments.due_date: Due at 1pm of the next day of the tutorial case-study
assessments.task_description:
Students will be assessed at the individual level during 2 tutorial case-study sessions. This will be done through individual submission of tutorial answers on Blackboard.

Individual level achievement within assessable tutorials will be assessed as follows:

  • There will be 2 tutorial case-studies to be assessed per student; each assessable tutorial is worth 15% of the overall mark.
  • Marking templates and assessment criteria for the Tutorials are available in the assessment folder on Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All tutorial case-study answers will need to be submitted via a submission link placed in the Assessment folder on the Blackboard website for the course.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
29/07/2024 - 4/10/2024

Can be submitted any time before the due date/time
assessments.task_description:
This exercise develops student's critical evaluation skills. It requires to investigate on a One Health topic and address it causes and control strategies based on their understanding of One Health concepts and ability to research scientific information. One Health topics for the One Health Assignment are available at The One Healther magazine on Flipboard (https://flipboard.com/@rjsmagalhaes/the-onehealther-7769qhifz ). Please consult tutors and course coordinator for adequancy of topic before the end of Week 2 of teaching.

Essay steps/structure:

1.     Find a disease topic of interest and relevance to One Health – The Onehealther magazine on Flipboard (https://flipboard.com/@rjsmagalhaes/the-onehealther-7769qhifz ) is the preferred source of topic options but students can also choose a topic not in The Onehealther.

2.     Please confirm topic choice with the course coordinator and/or tutor team before 4th August (before the end of Week 2). Topic needs to be chosen by Tutorial 2 so that students can navigate the tutorials from Week 3 onwards.

3.     The assignment is composed of two main parts: 

a.     Part 1: Why is my disease a One Health problem?

b.     Part 2: What are the best approaches to control and prevent my One Health disease topic?

4.     Students will be marked based on how they perform at addressing each component for each part of the assignment (please the One Health Assignment template and Marking rubric below)

5.     There will be a dedicated tutorial for each component (please see course timetable) and students are encouraged to attend the tutorials to learn how to tackle the content for the component.

The assignment should be between 1,500-2,000 words in length and include at least 10 references to scientifically valid information sources. The APA 7th referencing style should be used.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be uploaded and submitted as a Word document via a Turnitin link placed in the Assessment folder on the Blackboard website for the course.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Examination of students' understanding of factual and conceptual material developed in lectures and tutorials. Exam will be delivered on campus, invigilated, paper based exam.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial Series

Tutorials will be conducted every week of the semester. These are intended to be practical sessions to consolidate technical content but also to assist students with different sections of the assignment. Refer to the course schedule on Blackboard for details.
